java-basic.name: Basic
java-basic.description: The Basic ruleset contains a collection of good practices which should be followed.

java-braces.name: Braces
java-braces.description: The Braces ruleset contains rules regarding the use and placement of braces.

java-clone.name: Clone Implementation
java-clone.description: The Clone Implementation ruleset contains a collection of rules that find questionable usages of the clone() method.

java-codesize.name: Code Size
java-codesize.description: The Code Size ruleset contains rules that find problems related to code size or complexity.

java-comments.name: Comments
java-comments.description: Rules intended to catch errors related to code comments.

java-controversial.name: Controversial
java-controversial.description: The Controversial ruleset contains rules that, for whatever reason, are considered controversial.They are held here to allow people to include them as they see fit within their custom rulesets.

java-design.name: Design
java-design.description: The Design ruleset contains rules that flag suboptimal code implementations. Alternate approaches are suggested.

java-empty.name: Empty Code
java-empty.description: The Empty Code ruleset contains rules that find empty statements of any kind (empty method,empty block statement, empty try or catch block,...).

java-finalizers.name: Finalizers
java-finalizers.description: These rules deal with different problems that can occur with finalizers.

java-imports.name: Imports
java-imports.description: These rules deal with different problems that can occur with import statements.

java-j2ee.name: J2EE
java-j2ee.description: Rules specific to the use of J2EE implementations.

java-javabeans.name: JavaBeans
java-javabeans.description: The JavaBeans Ruleset catches instances of bean rules not being followed.

java-junit.name: JUnit
java-junit.description: These rules deal with different problems that can occur with JUnit tests.

java-logging-jakarta-commons.name: Jakarta Commons Logging
java-logging-jakarta-commons.description: The Jakarta Commons Logging ruleset contains a collection of rules that find questionable usages of that framework.

java-logging-java.name: Java Logging
java-logging-java.description: The Java Logging ruleset contains a collection of rules that find questionable usages of the logger.

java-naming.name: Naming
java-naming.description: The Naming Ruleset contains rules regarding preferred usage of names and identifiers.

java-optimizations.name: Optimizations
java-optimizations.description: These rules deal with different optimizations that generally apply to best practices.

java-strictexception.name: Strict Exceptions
java-strictexception.description: These rules provide some strict guidelines about throwing and catching exceptions.

java-strings.name: Strings
java-strings.description: These rules deal with different issues that can arise with manipulation of the String, StringBuffer, or StringBuilder instances.

java-sunsecure.name: Security
java-sunsecure.description: These rules check the security guidelines from Sun, published at http://java.sun.com/security/seccodeguide.html#gcg.

java-typeresolution.name: Type Resolution
java-typeresolution.description: These are rules which resolve java Class files for comparison, as opposed to a String.

java-unusedcode.name: Unused Code
java-unusedcode.description: The Unused Code ruleset contains rules that find unused or ineffective code.

java-unnecessary.name: Unnecessary Code
java-unnecessary.description: The Unnecessary Ruleset contains a collection of rules for unnecessary code.
